intro: Casearia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Casearia macrantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
